definition: 7th earthly branch: 11 a.m.-1 p.m., noon, 5th solar month (6th June-6th July), year of the Horse/ancient Chinese compass point: 180° (south)
to rest/to stop doing sth for a period of time/to cease/(imperative) don't

sentences.chinese: 我的午休時間是從12點到1點。

sentences.english: Four out of five people with insomnia sleep better at night without naps.
sentences.chinese: 患失眠的5人鐘有4人都感到不午休晚上睡得更香。

sentences.english: The photosynthetic depression at midday was due to non-stomatal factors.
sentences.chinese: 光午休現象主要是由非氣孔因素引起的。

sentences.english: All full-time employees get a one-hour lunch break.
sentences.chinese: 所有全職員工有一小時午休時間。

sentences.english: The judge called one last name before lunch.
sentences.chinese: 午休前，法官叫來了最後一名違章司機。

sentences.english: By morning time, cadres have consciously closed office fluorescent.
sentences.chinese: 而到了午休時間，機關幹部們自覺關閉辦公室日光燈。

sentences.english: Adriana:I booked them on-line yesterday during my lunch break at work.
sentences.chinese: 昨天我工作午休時在網上把票訂好了。

sentences.english: They sat by the field, and chatted during the noon break.
sentences.chinese: 午休時她們就坐在田邊扯閒篇了。

sentences.english: I mean, it's lot of people taking lunch breaks that live in midtown.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得，很多住在市中心的人在那兒度過午休時光。

sentences.english: If you’re a committed napper, you can skip all naps for a week.
sentences.chinese: 如果你是一個愛午休的人，你可以試着一星期不午睡。

sentences.english: It is known that countries where siestas are common tend to have lower levels of heart disease.
sentences.chinese: 據瞭解，常有午休的國家的心臟病機率要小很多。

sentences.english: Eventually, I settled on going to a health club during my lunch hour.
sentences.chinese: 最後，我決定在午休時間去一個健身俱樂部活動活動。

definition: time of going to work/the morning rush hour
to go to class/to attend class/to go to teach a class
to rest for a bit/to take a breather
to go to sleep/to go to bed (literary)
